meanings.definition: To make or become crisp or crisper.
meanings.sent1: I will crispen the cookies in the oven for a crunchy texture.
meanings.sent2: She likes to crispen the bacon until it is golden brown.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to crispen the edges of the pie crust for extra flavor.
meanings.sent4: The autumn air began to crispen, signaling the arrival of colder weather.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays helped crispen the leaves, creating a beautiful fall landscape.

meanings.definition: To make or become more intense or sharp.
meanings.sent1: His words crispened the tension in the room, making everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent2: The argument started to crispen as voices grew louder.
meanings.sent3: The suspense in the movie began to crispen, keeping the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: Her criticism crispened his determination to prove her wrong.
meanings.sent5: The rivalry between the two teams continued to crispen with each passing game.
